extendedInfo.description: Celtx Script syncs with Celtx on the desktop and in the cloud, so you can write your scripts anytime, anywhere and always work off the latest version.And now Script includes a comment stream, so you can make script notes to yourself or discuss scripts with writing and production partners. FeaturesÂ * Screenplay, AV, Stageplay, Audio Play, and Comic formats.Â * Sync scripts with Celtx in the cloud and on the desktop.* Add comments to make script notes to yourself or discuss scripts with partners. * Free backups and controlled sharing with a free Celtx account.* Element transitions match Celtx desktop software.Â * Preserves script markup from Celtx desktop software.* Cut/copy/paste across elements* Developed by the Celtx development team.

reviews.title: Perfect
reviews.comment: All I needed was an app to sync screenplays with computers and various android devices with, and it has performed wonderfully.   The only hiccup was the weird bug with the backspace key on the swiftkey keyboard, where it pasted the last few characters over and over instead of deleting anything. Other keyboards (stock, swype, and messagease) all work fine.
reviews.author: Cosmo Dusty

reviews.title: Definitely Needs Work
reviews.comment: I cannot believe what you guys are charging for this in it\'s current state it is definitely not worth 10 dollars.   I\'m not a cheap man, but this is the most expensive app I\'ve purchased, and I expected something better.   No ability to open celtx files from your phone\'s memory?   No undo/redo?   And I don\'t know if it\'s just with swift key but sometimes I\'ll hit backspace and it just adds more of the letter I am trying to erase.
reviews.author: Aaron Trainor

reviews.title: Literal perfection
reviews.comment: You literally cannot get any better than Celtx. It syncs with every device that I own, Apple comp, PC, Windows tablet and HTC One. I can work on my projects anywhere I am. It\'s perfection. I love it.
reviews.author: Jennifer hunter

reviews.title: No Manual External Save & Poor Functionality
reviews.comment: Buyer beware:  1. No way to manually save scripts to your preferred external microSD or external storage. No Dropbox, Google, Skydrive cloud. It only saves files on Celtx cloud,  2. Comic Script has poor formatting functions. As of this writing, when you create Pages & Panels it does format to make the necessary entries, but when you save the file and download it to your desktop, the script has extra Page & Panel markups! You will then be spending time editing these out! An annoying bug!  3. No undo/redo.
reviews.author: Ced Nocon

reviews.title: Needs option to open local files.
reviews.comment: If I\'ve saved a Celtx file to my tablet\'s local storage, I can\'t open it using the Celtx app. This seems very short-sighted. Also, there needs to be a tablet-optimised version of the app; I\'m trying to work on a Transformer Prime, and a stretched version of the mobile app doesn\'t cut it.
reviews.author: Stephen Graves

reviews.title: Great cloud integration. Swiftkey users beware.
reviews.comment: Good scriptwriting app. I love the ability to bounce back and forth between writing on my phone and my laptop because of the cloud integration. However, writing isn\'t as easy as it should be because for some reason the text editor on the app garbles up SwiftKey\'s predicted text. This doesn\'t happen though with the stock Samsung keyboard or Swype so the problem might be SwiftKey specific but then again I\'ve never encountered this problem with any other app.
reviews.author: Herrard Costales

reviews.title: Guys, it is still too bare for $10!
reviews.comment: I came to Script mobile late and was hoping that with all the feedback they\'ve been getting since its Apple days, they would have made the app somewhat functional. I don\'t believe they would have to reinvent word processing to include simple features like undo,  a clipboard and a few really practical page navigation features. It is still bare, and they are charging $10 for it. They forget we don\'t use their software because they are pretty people. We are \"loyal\" only because we associate the name Celtx with quality. They have an  awesome desktop application. But they believe they have reached the top of the mountain, and are resting on their Laurels. They only seem to want to \"monetize\" every piece of trash with Celtx tattooed on it. But  it\'s only a matter of time before someone else fills the void. That\'s how great products die. They stop respecting their customers. Please make it usable and charge even more, if you have to. We will probably pay! For now, I will write in some all purpose word processor while on the road, clipboard it into Celtx desktop and format. But who really wants to do triple duty! Do something before you die! Mobile is the future, not necessarily CLOUD.
reviews.author: Kobina Ansah

reviews.title: Great potential
reviews.comment: I purchased this so I could write on my tablet as well as on my laptop, sync them together and the whole nine yards. Works pretty good with the graphic novels, but currently this app has no ability to do novels (which is 90% of my writing). Would be great to have the ability to do that. It has great potential to being a big part of my writing workflow, but sadly it\'s kind of crippling when it comes to novel writing.
reviews.author: Tadd Mencer

reviews.title: No
reviews.comment: No undo and redo for a long time now. Celtx is sloppy on desktop and Android. I wish they would show if they\'re even still involved.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Great app. Save to local storage a plus. Needs documentation.
reviews.comment: App is great, everything works as advertised.... Documentation sucks, so finding out if it works as advertised takes effort - going onto celtx website forums. (Hate forums). Also - to save locally there\'s no pop up telling what folder being saved to. Only saves when exit completely (not hit home button) App looks like it might crash without any \'Saving\' type pop up. Took a lot of effort to find out if local storage actually worked or not. Almost lost a customer (at least on the mobile platform).  Please do not send customers to a forum as the only means of help. I just need simple documentation that every other full fledged program has. I can usually work it out from there. Searching through forums, with weak search algorithms and multiple week waits for responses is a complete buzz kill.  Otherwise, love the desktop app, love the cloud service (now that I discovered it saves to a website profile that you can actually edit inside the web browser) - Again, I\'ve used the desktop and mobile app for over a year and never knew about the website browser editor. The mobile app could use some tweaking - include more desktop features into the tablet port of the mobile app.  But I\'m happy!!!
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Broken with std keyboards
reviews.comment: Pressing enter messes up the formatting.. the primary task of this app :( Works with Google keyboard released in June, but not the older one. Nor with Swype. Do some QA guys!
reviews.author: Garth C Huxley

reviews.title: Lacking but useful
reviews.comment: Undo/redo buttons, pdf converter, bold/italic  buttons. Thats all it needs to make it perfect!
reviews.author: priesnanda dwisatria

reviews.title: Needs a few updates
reviews.comment: I can\'t seem to figure out how to add act breaks and things like that. There doesn\'t appear to be an option.
reviews.author: Kenneth O\'Brien

reviews.title: Need to be improved, now!
reviews.comment: For this price you Must provide a serious app. Cannot export PDF, cannot share, cannot work with cards. Plus some crash ( not too frequently on nexus 7). Please bring this app to the level of the desktop S.W. thanks.
reviews.author: Sergio Rufini Mastropasqua

reviews.title: Great App needs to be ironed out still
reviews.comment: The cloud is still not recognizing updates between devices & desktop
reviews.author: Luke Williams

reviews.title: Not bad, but does have issues
reviews.comment: It\'s a decent app, but it really needs support for bold, italics, underlining, and pagination.
reviews.author: Spencer Green

reviews.title: Issues
reviews.comment: Buggy as hell
reviews.author: jonathan palo

reviews.title: Almost perfect!
reviews.comment: Great app, easy to use. Just wrote a shirt film script in 30 minutes! Very simple tools and quick commands and switching from character to dialog to action, etc. Needs to be able to share script and export on sdcard as a pdf or txt file, then it\'ll get 5 stars! I promise!
reviews.author: Phillip Seitz

reviews.title: Doesn\'t Work
reviews.comment: Can see my scripts listed but can\'t view or edit them at all.   Very disappointed with this app.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Need so much more for the price!
reviews.comment: Export to pdf? Etc etc  We need it to do what the desk top version does please?
reviews.author: charles dyson
